seo.title: How to reach Positano on a budget
seo.description: Cheapest routes from Naples Airport to Positano using shuttle + SITA bus, with step-by-step directions and costs.

linkLabel: How to reach Positano on a budget
intro: Use the Naples Airport → Sorrento shuttle, then the SITA bus to Positano for the cheapest, most reliable connection.

sections.title: Why this route works
body: One shuttle (~€10) plus one SITA bus (~€2.10) keeps the total under €13, far cheaper than ferries or taxis.
Both legs drop you near Chiesa Nuova so you avoid long Positano staircases with luggage.

sections.title: Before you leave
body: Pre-book the Curreri shuttle online when travelling in peak months, or buy from the desk just outside arrivals and allow a 15-minute buffer after landing.
Carry small cash for SITA tickets in Sorrento; kiosks and tabacchi along Corso Italia sell them and may refuse large bills late at night.

sections.title: Timing & backup plans
body: Note the last Curreri departure of the day (often ~21:30 in summer, earlier off-season) and plan your flight accordingly.
Missed the shuttle? Switch to Alibus + Circumvesuviana or Campania Express to Sorrento and continue with the same SITA bus route.

steps.name: Naples Airport → Sorrento (Curreri Viaggi)
steps.text: Exit arrivals and board the Curreri shuttle to Sorrento station. Ticket ~€10; duration ~1h 15m.

steps.name: Sorrento → Positano (SITA bus)
steps.text: Buy a SITA CIS ticket (~€2.10). Take the bus toward Amalfi and get off at Positano Chiesa Nuova.

steps.name: Walk to Hostel Brikette
steps.text: From Chiesa Nuova stop, walk ~80m downhill (no stairs) to the hostel entrance.

trainTitle: Train + bus (slightly pricier, can be faster)
train: Alibus from NAP → Napoli Centrale (Garibaldi), then Circumvesuviana to Sorrento (~€6 total).
SITA from Sorrento → Positano (~€2.10). Time: ~2–2.5 h total.
ferry: Alibus → Molo Beverello, ferry to Positano (summer only; €20–€38 depending on operator).
Check our ferry schedules guide for live timetables.

faq.a: Naples Airport → Sorrento shuttle, then SITA bus to Positano (Chiesa Nuova).

faq.q: Where do I buy bus tickets?
faq.a: At tobacconists/kiosks near stations; buy before boarding and validate on the bus.
Around 2.5 hours total with smooth connections.

ferryCta: Prefer ferries in summer? See our dedicated ferry guide and our assistance article on Arriving by Ferry for port tips and accessibility notes.
